docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 10 (AP) -- The International Telecommunications Union, which represents eighty-two countries and colonies, today overwhelmingly approved a resolution endorsing the principle of "unrestricted" flow of news throughout the world.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11 -- The General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee approved today a proposal pushed by Bolivia and Iran intended to promote the nationalization of resource industries in less developed countries. The majority...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11 -- The General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee approved today a proposal pushed by Bolivia and Iran intended to promote the nationalization of resource industries in less developed countries. The majority prevented the United States and other defenders of the rights of private investors from expressing their views, and rejected any reference to such rights.

docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 11 -- The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization ended its seventh general conference today by adopting a program of activities for the next two years within the limit of the $18,000,000 budget that the delegates had previously approved.

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 12 -- The Asian-Arab group lost its fight today for a United Nations General Assembly resolution that would have called on France to resume negotiations with the "true representatives of the Tunisian people" regarding the independence of the protectorate of Tunisia.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 14 -- Argentina's decision to drop, at least for the present, measures taken against Uruguay for supposedly having recognized British sovereignty over the Falkland Islands has produced general satisfaction here. Uruguayans...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 14 -- Argentina's decision to drop, at least for the present, measures taken against Uruguay for supposedly having recognized British sovereignty over the Falkland Islands has produced general satisfaction here. Uruguayans have always denied there was any ground for the Argentine action.

docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 14 -- The return of Miguel Miranda, former economic czar of Argentina, from voluntary exile in Uruguay has lifted the Argentine stock market out of the doldrums and has encouraged a flurry of reports that President Juan D. Peron soon may announce many changes in his Government.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 16 -- The Uruguayan National Congress concluded its 1952 session at midnight last night without acting to ratify the Military Assistance Agreement with the United States that was signed here last June 30. Rumors that a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 16 -- The Uruguayan National Congress concluded its 1952 session at midnight last night without acting to ratify the Military Assistance Agreement with the United States that was signed here last June 30. Rumors that a special session will be called to vote on that treaty have not been confirmed.
docs.abstract: Cong takes no action on pact as Nationalists delay vote

headline.main: URUGUAYANS DELAY U. S. MILITARY PACT; Nationalists, as in Brazil, Pose Fake Issues and Congress Quits Without Action

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 17 -- The Social, Humanitarian and Cultural Committee, by a vote of 37 to 0, approved today the proposed convention on political rights for women and sent it to the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 17 -- The Social, Humanitarian and Cultural Committee, by a vote of 37 to 0, approved today the proposed convention on political rights for women and sent it to the United Nations General Assembly.
